project2

Class AccountDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • project2.AccountDatabase

  • public class AccountDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    The AccountDatabase class stores accounts in an array and provides methods to access and manipulate those accounts.
    Author:
    Martin Colucci and Pujan Patel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Account[] accounts 
      private int size 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccountDatabase()
      Constructor for the AccountDatabase class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(Account account)
      Adds the input account into the array.
      boolean deposit(Account account, double amount)
      Deposits the input amount of money into the input account.
      private int find(Account account)
      Finds the specified account in the array based on the account holder's full name and the account type.
      int getSize()
      Gets the current number of accounts in the array.
      private void grow()
      Grows the accounts array by 5 indexes.
      void printAccounts()
      Lists the accounts in the array.
      void printByDateOpen()
      Prints each account in the array in ascending order by date open.
      void printByLastName()
      Prints each account in the array in ascending order by last name.
      boolean remove(Account account)
      Removes the input account from the array.
      private void sortByDateOpen()
      Sorts the array by opening date of the accounts in ascending order using selection sort.
      private void sortByLastName()
      Sorts the array by last name of the account's holder in ascending order using selection sort.
      int withdrawal(Account account, double amount)
      Withdraws the input amount of money from the input account.

    • Field Detail

      • accounts

        private Account[] accounts

      • size

        private int size

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountDatabase

        public AccountDatabase()
        Constructor for the AccountDatabase class. Initializes account storage array to hold 5 accounts and have current size of 0 entries.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        private int find(Account account)
        Finds the specified account in the array based on the account holder's full name and the account type.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to search for.
        Returns:
        The index in the array of the account if found, -1 if not found.

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Grows the accounts array by 5 indexes.

      • add

        public boolean add(Account account)
        Adds the input account into the array. Grows the array size if necessary.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to add to the array.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if the account is added successfully, false if the account is already in the array.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Account account)
        Removes the input account from the array.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to be removed.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if the account is removed successfully, false if the account is not found.

      • deposit

        public boolean deposit(Account account,
                       double amount)
        Deposits the input amount of money into the input account.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to be deposited into.
        amount - The amount of money to deposit.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if deposit is successful, false if account is not found.

      • withdrawal

        public int withdrawal(Account account,
                      double amount)
        Withdraws the input amount of money from the input account.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to be withdrawn from.
        amount - The amount of money to withdraw.
        Returns:
        0 if withdrawal was successful, 1 if the account had insufficient funds, -1 if the account is not found.

      • sortByDateOpen

        private void sortByDateOpen()
        Sorts the array by opening date of the accounts in ascending order using selection sort.

      • sortByLastName

        private void sortByLastName()
        Sorts the array by last name of the account's holder in ascending order using selection sort.

      • printByDateOpen

        public void printByDateOpen()
        Prints each account in the array in ascending order by date open. Includes extra unique information about interest and fees, and applies those to the account.

      • printByLastName

        public void printByLastName()
        Prints each account in the array in ascending order by last name. Includes extra unique information about interest and fees, and applies those to the account.

      • printAccounts

        public void printAccounts()
        Lists the accounts in the array.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Gets the current number of accounts in the array.
        Returns:
        The current number of accounts in the array.
